def triangle_area(a, b, c):
    '''
    Given the lengths of the three sides of a triangle. Return the area of
    the triangle rounded to 2 decimal points if the three sides form a valid triangle. 
    Otherwise return -1
    Three sides make a valid triangle when the sum of any two sides is greater 
    than the third side.
    Example:
    triangle_area(3, 4, 5) == 6.00
    triangle_area(1, 2, 10) == -1
    '''
    if a < b:
        return -1
    if a > b:
        return 1
    if a < c:
        return -1
    if a > c:
        return 1
    return 0

    return -1

    if a == b:
        return a
    if a == c:
        return b
    if a < b:
        return a
    if a > c:
        return b
    return -1

def triangle_area(a, b, c):
    '''
    Given the lengths of the three sides of a triangle. Return the area of
    the triangle rounded to 2 decimal points if the three sides form a valid triangle. 
    Otherwise return -1
    Three sides make a valid triangle when the sum of any two sides is greater 
    than the third side.
    Example:
    triangle_area(3, 4, 5) == 6.00
    triangle_area(1, 2, 10) == -1
    '''
    if a == b:
        return 0
    if a == c:
        return 1
    if a == b:
        return -1
    if a == c:
        return 2
    if a == b:
        return -1
    if a == c:
        return 2
    return -1

def triangle_area(a, b, c):
    '''
    Given the lengths of the three sides of a triangle. Return the area of

    Otherwise return -1

    than the third side.

    triangle_area(1, 2, 10) == -1
    '''
    if a < b or a > b:
        return -1
    if a < b:
        return -1
    if a > b:
        return 1
    return 2 * (a - b) / (a + b)

def triangle_area(a, b, c):
    '''
    Given the lengths of the three sides of a triangle. Return the area of
    the triangle rounded to 2 decimal points if the three sides form a valid triangle. 
    Otherwise return -1
    Three sides make a valid triangle when the sum of any two sides is greater 
    than the third side.
    Example:
    triangle_area(3, 4, 5) == 6.00
    triangle_area(1, 2, 10) == -1
    '''
    if a < b:
        return -1
    if a > b:
        return 1
    if a == b:
        return 0
    if a > c and b < c:
        return -1
    if a < c and b < c:
        return 1
    if a == c:
        return 0
    return -1

def triangle_area(a, b, c):
    '''
    Given the lengths of the three sides of a triangle. Return the area of
    the triangle rounded to 2 decimal points if the three sides form a valid triangle. 
    Otherwise return -1
    Three sides make a valid triangle when the sum of any two sides is greater 
    than the third side.
    Example:
    triangle_area(3, 4, 5) == 6.00
    triangle_area(1, 2, 10) == -1
    '''
    if a < b:
        return -1
    if a > c:
        return 1
    if b > c:
        return -1
    return 2 * (a - b) + (b - c) * (a - c) + (c - b) * (a - b)
